dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Virginia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Controlled Substances Act and the Controlled Substances Import and Export Act regarding penalties for cocaine offenses, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness in Cocaine Sentencing Act of 2013.

section.header: Elimination of increased penalties for cocaine offenses where the cocaine involved is cocaine base

subsection.text: The following provisions of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 801 et seq.) are repealed:

paragraph.text: The sentence beginning Notwithstanding the preceding sentence in section 404(a).

subsection.header: Controlled Substances Import and Export Act
